opendial.domains.rules.parameters

Class StochasticParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.domains.rules.parameters.StochasticParameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parameter

    public class StochasticParameter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parameter
    Parameter represented by a single distribution over a continuous variable. If the variable is multivariate, the parameter represents a specific dimension of the multivariate distribution.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-01-21 00:18:30 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StochasticParameter(java.lang.String paramId)
      Creates a new stochastic parameter for a univariate distribution.
      StochasticParameter(java.lang.String paramId, int dimension)
      Creates a new stochastic parameter for a particular dimension of a multivariate distribution.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getParameterIds()
      Returns a singleton with the parameter label

      Returns the actual value for the parameter, as given in the input assignment (as a DoubleVal or ArrayVal).
      int hashCode()
      Returns the hashcode for the parameter

      Creates a composite parameter with the multiplication of the two parameters

      • getParameterValue

        public double getParameterValue(Assignment input)
                         throws DialException
        Returns the actual value for the parameter, as given in the input assignment (as a DoubleVal or ArrayVal). If the value is not given, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        getParameterValue in interface Parameter
        Parameters:
        input - the input assignment
        Returns:
        the actual value for the parameter
        Throws:
        DialException - if the value is not specified in the input assignment
